Private Litigation Case Title: Copeland-Stewart v. New York Life Insurance Company

Company: New York Life Investment Management LLC

Description: A jury awarded the plaintiff $6 million in compensatory damages and $10 million in punitive damages, but an appeals court threw out the punitive damages award (6th Cir., No. 07-4186).
Private Litigation Case Title: Morgan v. New York Life Insurance Company
Mehling, et al v. New York Life Insurance Co, et al

Description: New York Life agreed to pay $15 million to settle multistate litigation regarding its use of the Social Security Administration's Death Master File.
Info Source: Settlement Reached in Death Master Case with NY Life, States News Service, October 24, 2013 (via Nexis).

Company: New York Life Insurance and Annuity Corp.
New York Life Insurance Co. et al.
Description: New York Life Insurance Co., New York Life Insurance and Annuity Corp., and NYLIFE Insurance Co. of Arizona agreed to pay $800,000 to the state as part of a settlement of allegations they had inadequate procedures to ensure policies and other funds were timely investigated and paid out to beneficiaries.

Agency: New Hampshire Bureau of Securities Regulation

Description: NASD settled cases against four firms involving mutual fund sales violations.
Info Source: NASD Settles Cases Against MML Investors Services, NYLIFE Securities, Securities America and Northwestern Mutual Investment Services for Fines Totaling over $1.2 Million for Failures Relating to Mutual Fund Sales, States News Service, June 28, 2007 (via Nexis).
Notes: FINRA is a securities industry self-regulatory body authorized by the federal government. This case was handled by its predecessor, the National Association of Securities Dealers (NASD).

Description: NASD censured and fined 29 securities firms over $9.2 million for more than 8,000 late disclosures of reportable information about their brokers, including customer complaints, regulatory actions, and criminal charges and convictions.
Info Source: NASD Fines 29 Firms over $9.2 Million for Late Reporting, PR Newswire, November 30, 2004 (via Nexis).
Notes: FINRA is a securities industry self-regulatory body authorized by the federal government. This case was handled by its predecessor, the National Association of Securities Dealers (NASD).

Company: New York Life Insurance Company and New York Life Insurance and Annuity Corporation
